p: A region of notable Ae. aegypti and DENV emergence is the temperate Southern Cone of South America. Early cases of dengue fever were reported in Argentina in 1916, and no cases were reported for 80 years [ 43]. Ae aegypti was eliminated from all of Argentina in 1963 following aggressive vector control campaigns in response to the yellow fever pandemic; however, the vector became re-established in its historic range and has spread into new southern latitudes. By 1986, the vector was detected in the northeast subtropical region, and in 1997 the first autochthonous cases were confirmed in northwestern Argentina [ 43].
